content.description: To reach the first bolt, scramble up to a ledge and carefully around a tall, vertical block that looks very loose. Climb slightly overhanging rock. This is kind of pumpy.
content.location: It is on the face right of the large pine tree.

content.description: Start by climbing up to a ledge where the first bolt is reached. This route climbs on the arete or just right of the arete. It is kind of thin and technical.
content.location: On the face right of the large pine tree, this is the left route.

content.description: Easy Left Face 2 is well-protected and very easy.
content.location: This is the second route from the left.

content.description: Easy Left Face is well-protected and increases substantially near the middle of the route, after the second bolt.  It continues to increase in difficulty until a fun steep (but easier) move right at the top.
content.location: This is the leftmost face route.

content.description:
Follow an obvious crack in an easy, staircase-llike formation with two moves maybe three to a nice ledge. Continue following the crack to a flake/boulder. A few more jugs lead around crack system to gentle boulder ledge.

This is a good, fun, juggy first trad route or a good warm-up!
content.protection: Stoppers #6, 7, 4, hex #2, Tricam #1.5, and self-clean or find something to rap off. This is possibly toprope-able.
content.location: Either approach from “Upper Left” or follow a trail from campsite #4 straight to a boulderfield, and follow a face up past cairns.
